TopicTitle: Drag rudder option for other control surfaces

Articles.Content:
We have A.I.R.B.R.A.K.E.S. and they can work as drag rudders. Would be even better if we could set it for other control surfaces too.

they can be used for roll and pitch

they can be used for roll and pitch

But not for yaw when in horizontal position. Can't make a flying wing without those.
what about using action groups for toggling regular control surfaces?

what about using action groups for toggling regular control surfaces?

Thought about that, but came to conclusion it would require a lot of work just to yaw. You have to deflect them more and deflect them less. And have to do that for both sides. That's 4 different action groups used just to yaw the thing left and right. And it's not a very efficient way to do that either. SAS also doesn't help you to balance things out if you do it that way.

Edited August 31, 2015 by Veeltch
I built an only drag-controlled thing once, with Mk.2 elevons. But an option for toggling it would be nice.

But not for yaw when in horizontal position. Can't make a flying wing without those.
